# trimDuration

**Instance Property**

An optional duration that overrides the calculated duration.

## Declaration

```swift
var trimDuration: TimeInterval? { get set }
```

## Discussion

The framework calculates [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/duration], but you can set this property to override it. This property is `nil` by default, which indicates that the animation stops after one play that spans [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/duration].

If you set a non-zero value for this property and both [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimStart] and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimEnd] are `nil`, the animation observes this property as an edited duration.

When you set [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/repeatMode] to make the animation repeat:

- If this property is `nil`, the animation repeats forever.
- If set to a value greater than [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/duration], the animation repeats for the specified duration.

## Timing the animation

- **speed**: A factor that increases or decreases the animation’s rate of playback.
- **delay**: An amount of time that lapses before the animation plays.
- **duration**: The total playback time of the animation.
- **offset**: The time, in seconds, at which the animation begins within the duration.
- **trimStart**: The time, in seconds, at which the source animation plays.
- **trimEnd**: The time, in seconds, at which the source animation stops.
